title: btcchamp88
author: btcchamp88
content: hey im new, what is the difference between bitcoin and bitcoin cash? can anyone explain in short words?

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Bitcoin cash is an altcoin. It forked from bitcoin. An hard fork. When there was a disagreement in the bitcoin community to increase bitcoin block size or not, the community divided and the people that wanted increase in block size later resulted to bitcoin cash creation while bitcoin remain to be bitcoin. After the hard fork that led to bitcoin cash, people that have bitcoin on their wallet are given the same amount in bitcoin cash which they can claim it on the bitcoin cash wallet with their bitcoin private key.Bitcoin cash is not the same as bitcoin, it is forked from bitcoin and it is one of the altcoins.

comments.author: Fundamentals Of
comments.body: Bitcoin is the decentralized cryptocurrency that was created by Satoshi Nakamoto. Bitcoin Cash, on the other hand, is the alternate cryptocurrency that was forked from Satoshi's Bitcoin. In other words, Bitcoin is the original version and Bitcoin Cash is the new version. This was one of the results of the block size debate or block size war as others call it in which Bitcoin supporters are divided as to whether or not to increase Bitcoin's block size. This was in relation to the scalability concern. Bitcoin sticks to 1 MB while Bitcoin Cash chose 32 MB. The implementation of Segwit however increases Bitcoin's block size to 4 MB.

comments.body: Quote from: btcchamp88 on August 14, 2023, 07:58:26 PMhey im new, what is the difference between bitcoin and bitcoin cash? can anyone explain in short words? Two different coins, which rose because of a hard fork that was created as a result of a disagreement of opinions in the community. Bitcoin Core (BTC) is the real bitcoin while Bitcoin Cash (BCH) is the altcoin that was created. Please note the moniker and trade accordingly, based on which one you find as the most convincing. There is a group of influential shills promoting BCH, which was much more buzzing during that time than now but they still exist and they live in their own bubble and forum.Also note that those who held bitcoin during the fork have received BCH of equivalent amount on the day of the fork. There are official ways to retrieve it, but try not to fall for scammers promising you the same.
